questions.question:
Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$2x+3y =5xy$$
questions.solution:
The given statement is incorrect as the equality of the LHS and RHS of the equation cannot be determined and is not applicable for all the values of $$x$$ and $$y$$..
The correct statement will be:
$$2x+ 3y = 2x+ 3y$$

questions.question:
Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$ \dfrac{3x}{3x+2} =\dfrac12 $$
questions.solution:
The given statement is incorrect.
As we cannot separate the denominators, the statement will remain as it is.
Therefore correct statement is
$$ \dfrac{3x}{3x+2} = \dfrac{3x}{3x+2} $$

questions.question:
Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$ \dfrac{3x^{2}}{3x^{2}} =0 $$
questions.solution:
The statement is incorrect. Like terms after cancellation leave remainder as $$1$$.
Therefore the correct statement is
$$ \dfrac{3x^{2}}{3x^{2}} =1 $$

questions.question:
Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$x+2x+3x = 5x$$
questions.solution:
The given statement is incorrect.
As all the terms have the same variable $$x$$, therefore we can add them.
Hence, the correct statement is: 
$$x+2x+3x= 6x$$

questions.question:
Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$5y+2y+y-7y =0$$
questions.solution:
The given statement is incorrect.
As all the terms have same variable, we can perform operation of addition and subtraction.
Therefore, the correct statement is 
$$5y+2y+y-7y = y$$

questions.question:
Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$ \dfrac{4x+5}{4x} =5 $$
questions.solution:
The given statement is incorrect.
After separating the denominators, we get
$$ \dfrac{4x+5}{4x} = 1+ \dfrac{5}{4x} $$ which is the correct statement.

questions.question:
Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$ \dfrac{3}{4x+3} =\dfrac1{4x} $$
questions.solution:
The given statement is incorrect.
As we cannot separate the denominators, the statement will remain as it is.
Therefore, correct statement is
$$ \dfrac{3}{4x+3} = \dfrac{3}{4x+3} $$

questions.question:
Identify the terms, their coefficients for each of the following expressions.

(i) $$5xyz^2-3zy$$(ii) $$1+x+x^2$$(iii) $$4x^2y^2-4x^2y^2z^2+z^2$$(iv) $$3-pq+qr-rp$$(v) $$\dfrac{x}{2}+\dfrac{y}{2}-xy$$(vi) $$0.3a-0.6ab+0.5b$$

Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$ \dfrac{3x^{2}+1}{3x^{2}} =1+1 =2 $$
questions.solution:
The given statement is incorrect.
After separating the denominators, we get 
$$ \dfrac{3x^{2}+1}{3x^{2}} =1+\dfrac{1}{3x^{2}} $$
The above statement is the correct one.

questions.question:
Find and correct errors of the following mathematical expressions:
$$ \dfrac{7x+5}{5} =7x $$
questions.solution:
The given statement is incorrect.
We will get correct statement by separating denominators, which is
$$ \dfrac{7x+5}{5} = 1+ \dfrac{7x}{5} $$
